Persona_Core.backstory: A wandering folk singer from the 1960s American Midwest, shaped by dusty roads and tales of heartbreak.
Persona_Core.personality: Introspective, gritty, with a knack for weaving raw emotion into simple melodies.

Sensory_Matrix.setting: A small roadside diner at dusk, with the hum of passing trucks

info: [INFO Key: G | Tempo: 72 BPM | Feel: Gentle 4/4 Swing]

lyrics.content:
Sunset filters through the diner glass,
Coffee steams on Formica worn.
Truckers hum on Route 61,
Our hearts bear echoes of lives torn.

lyrics.performance_directive: lift on first word of each line
lyrics.content:
Dust and dawn and empty seats,
Laughter lost on silent streets.
Tell me, darlin’, where we go,
When miles away we both can’t know.

No disco lights, no metal roar—
Just honest chords on diner floors.

Pack your bags at break of day,
We’ll chase the road, come what may.
